intro: Notoleptopus, commonly known as the giant sea anemone, is a marine invertebrate belonging to the order Pennatulacea. It is characterized by its large, fleshy body and long, delicate tentacles that surround its central oral disc. The plant-like structure of Notoleptopus is supported by a calcareous internal skeleton, which provides structural strength. It thrives in shallow coastal waters and is often found attached to rocks or other substrates. Its vibrant coloration and unique morphology make it a notable species in marine ecosystems.
